name: Boric acid
desc: Boric acid, also called hydrogen borate, boracic acid, orthoboric acid and acidum boricum, is a weak, monobasic Lewis acid of boron often used as an antiseptic, insecticide, flame retardant, neutron absorber, or precursor to other chemical compounds. It has the chemical formula H3BO3 (sometimes written B(OH)3), and exists in the form of colorless crystals or a white powder that dissolves in water. When occurring as a mineral, it is called sassolite.
Other names:
Orthoboric acid,
Boracic acid,
Sassolite,
Optibor,
Borofax,
Trihydroxyborane,
Boron(III) hydroxide,
Boron Trihydroxide
Solubility in other solvents:
Soluble in lower alcohols
moderately soluble in pyridine
very slightly soluble in acetone
